oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Microscopic description of 295 MeV polarized protons incident on Sn isotopes
oai_dc:dc.dc:creator: HAIDER, W
SHARMA, M
GAMBHIR, YK
KAILAS, S
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: mean-field-theory
reaction cross-sections
elastic-scattering
nucleus scattering
brueckner theory
finite nuclei
charge radii
neutron skin
model
density
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: We present a Brueckner theory analysis of proton-scattering data from Sn isotopes at 295 MeV. A soft-core Urbana v(14) internucleon potential has been used to calculate reaction matrices that are folded with point-nucleon (both proton and neutron) densities obtained in the relativistic mean field (RMF) framework to calculate the optical potential. We get reasonably satisfactory agreement with the differential cross-section and analyzing-power data using only three scaling parameters for all isotopes. It is observed that the calculated neutron skin increases smoothly as the neutron number increases, in conformity with earlier findings.
